member.name: T:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.SemanticLogging.Sinks.SqlDatabaseSink
member.summary: Sink that asynchronously writes entries to SQL Server database.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.SemanticLogging.Sinks.SqlDatabaseSink.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.TimeSpan,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified instance name, connection string and table name.
member.param: The name of the instance originating the entries.
The connection string.
The name of the table.
The buffering interval between each batch publishing.
The number of entries that will trigger a batch publishing.
The maximum number of entries that can be buffered while it's sending to the store before the sink starts dropping entries.

Defines a timeout interval for when flushing the entries after an call is received and before disposing the sink. This means that if the timeout period elapses, some event entries will be dropped and not sent to the store. Normally, calling on the will block until all the entries are flushed or the interval elapses. If is specified, then the call will block indefinitely until the flush operation finishes.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.SemanticLogging.Sinks.SqlDatabaseSink.Finalize
member.summary: Finalizes an instance of the class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.SemanticLogging.Sinks.SqlDatabaseSink.FlushAsync
member.returns: The Task that flushes the buffer.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.SemanticLogging.Sinks.SqlDatabaseSink.Dispose
member.summary: Releases all resources used by the current instance of the class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.SemanticLogging.Sinks.SqlDatabaseSink.OnCompleted
member.summary: Notifies the observer that the provider has finished sending push-based notifications.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.SemanticLogging.Sinks.SqlDatabaseSink.OnError(System.Exception)
member.summary: Notifies the observer that the provider has experienced an error condition.
member.param: An object that provides additional information about the error.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.SemanticLogging.Sinks.SqlDatabaseSink.OnNext(Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.SemanticLogging.EventEntry)
member.summary: Provides the sink with new data to write.
member.param: The current entry to write to the database.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.SemanticLogging.Sinks.SqlDatabaseSink.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Performs application-defined tasks associated with freeing, releasing, or resetting unmanaged resources.
member.param: A value indicating whether or not the class is disposing.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.SemanticLogging.SqlDatabaseLog
member.summary: Factories and helpers for using the .

member.name: F:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.SemanticLogging.SqlDatabaseLog.DefaultTableName
member.summary: Default table name used to write traces.

member.param: The event stream. Typically this is an instance of .
The name of the instance originating the entries.
The connection string.
The name of the table.
The buffering interval between each batch publishing. Default value is .
The number of entries that will trigger a batch publishing.

Defines a timeout interval for when flushing the entries after an call is received and before disposing the sink. This means that if the timeout period elapses, some event entries will be dropped and not sent to the store. Normally, calling on the will block until all the entries are flushed or the interval elapses. If is specified, then the call will block indefinitely until the flush operation finishes.

The maximum number of entries that can be buffered while it's sending to SQL Database before the sink starts dropping entries. This means that if the timeout period elapses, some event entries will be dropped and not sent to the store. Normally, calling on the will block until all the entries are flushed or the interval elapses. If is specified, then the call will block indefinitely until the flush operation finishes.
member.returns: A subscription to the sink that can be disposed to unsubscribe the sink and dispose it, or to get access to the sink instance.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.SemanticLogging.SqlDatabaseLog.CreateListener(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Nullable{System.TimeSpan},System.Int32,System.Nullable{System.TimeSpan},System.Int32)
member.summary: Subscribes to the listener using a .
member.param: The name of the instance originating the entries.
The connection string.
The name of the table.
The buffering interval between each batch publishing.
The number of entries that will trigger a batch publishing.

Defines a timeout interval for the flush operation when the listener is disposed. This means that if the timeout period elapses, some event entries will be dropped and not sent to the store. Calling on the will block until all the entries are flushed or the interval elapses. If is specified, then the call will block indefinitely until the flush operation finishes.

The maximum number of entries that can be buffered while it's sending to SQL Database before the sink starts dropping entries. This means that if the timeout period elapses, some event entries will be dropped and not sent to the store. Normally, calling on the will block until all the entries are flushed or the interval elapses. If is specified, then the call will block indefinitely until the flush operation finishes.
member.returns: An event listener that uses to log events.
